verses.roman:
śāpo me 'nugrahāyaiva
kṛtas taiḥ karuṇātmabhiḥ
yad ahaṁ loka-guruṇā
padā spṛṣṭo hatāśubhaḥ

synonyms: śāpaḥ—the curse; me—my; anugrahāya—for the benediction; eva—certainly; kṛtaḥ—created; taiḥ—by them; karuṇa-ātmabhiḥ—who are merciful by nature; yat—since; aham—I; loka—of all the worlds; guruṇā—by the spiritual master; padā—with His foot; spṛṣṭaḥ—touched; hata—destroyed; aśubhaḥ—all inauspiciousness.
translation: It was actually for my benefit that those merciful sages cursed me, since now I have been touched by the foot of the supreme spiritual master of all the worlds and have thus been relieved of all inauspiciousness.
